name: 語言教學專題討論
goals: to provide an introduction to how L2 development have been conceptualized, researched and explained in recent decades
to consider how scholarly as well as popular theories of language learning underlie language education policy, curriculum and materials development, and classroom practices.
to develop critical thinking skills about scholarly inquiry, theories of language learning, language policy and our own pedagogical or research practices.
syllabus:
This course aims to enhance students’ research capability through the critical evaluation of research papers and reports. It engages students in the critique of a range of research papers which adopt different research approaches underpinned by different theoretical perspectives and use different research designs and methodologies for data collection and analysis. This course will be taught by two professors as well as guest speakers who will take turns to guide students in the evaluation process, to share their own experience of conducting research, and to critique their samples of own published work. Students will have opportunities to present their own research ideas and obtain feedback in class. Each student will be required to write a proposal for their research project at the end of the course.
